title: RL33020
content: Stopping the ability of terrorists to finance their operations is a key component of the U.S.counterterrorism strategy. To accomplish this, the Administration has implemented a three-tieredapproach based on (1) intelligence and domestic legal and regulatory efforts; (2) technical assistanceto provide capacity-building programs for U.S. allies; and (3) global efforts to create internationalnorms and guidelines. Effective implementation of this strategy requires the participation of, and coordinationamong, several elements of the U.S. Government. This report provides an agency-by-agency surveyof U.S. efforts. This report will be updated as events warrant.
